2016 Connecticut Civic Health Index Dashboard

Download Raw Data

Download raw data using the link above or explore the raw data tables here first.

These tables present the results of the Tufts University Center for Information and Research on Civic Learning and Engagement (CIRCLE) analysis of the U.S. Census Current Population Survey(CPS). Volunteering estimates are from the CPS September Volunteering Supplement. Voting estimates are from the 2012 November Voting and Registration Supplement. All other civic engagement indicators come from the 2013 CPS Civic Engagement Supplement.

Because multiple sources of data with varying sample sizes are used, the report is not able to compute one margin of error for Connecticut across all indicators. Any analysis that breaks down the sample into smaller groups (e.g., gender, education) will have smaller samples and therefore the margin of error will increase. Data for some indicators are pooled (2010-2013) for a more reliable estimate when sample sizes for certain cross tabulations may have been small. thermore, national rankings, while useful in benchmarking, may be small in range, with one or two percentage points separating the state/district ranked first from the state/district ranked last.

It is also important that our margin of error estimates are approximate, as CPS sampling is highly complex and accurate estimation of error rates involves many parameters that are not publicly available.
